data.title: StayApart Hotels in Byagadahalli
data.meta_description: Byagadahalli is a small Village/hamlet in Chickmagalur Taluk in Chikmagalur District of Karnataka State, India. It comes under Aralaguppe Panchayath. This village is very calm and full of natural vegetation.
data.text:
Murkannu Gudda And Hadlu Waterfalls

Located 250 km from Bangalore, Sakleshpur, one of the enchanting hill stations in the Western Ghats, is the home to the Murkannu Gudda and Hadlu Waterfalls. Showcasing rich biodiversity, an 8 kilometres guided trek is one of the most beautiful and popular treks in the region. This waterfall offers to be a perfect getaway for the people who want to enjoy an ideal getaway from the monotonous life and reconnect with nature.

Bisle View Point

Get ready to be mesmerised by some enchanting views of the Western Ghats from Bisle View Point when you are touring Sakleshpur. It is among the most mesmerising places to visit in Sakleshpur for sightseeing and escape the humdrum affairs of life. Located near Bisle Ghat, this place offers a breathtaking view of three mountain ranges which are Yenikallu Betta, Doddabetta and Pushpagiri and Kumaraparvatha.

Shettihalli rosary church

Shettihalli Church is located 2km from Shettihalli, Hassan, in Karnataka. Built in the 1860s by the French missionaries in India, the church is a magnificent structure of Gothic Architecture. After the construction of the Hemavati Dam and Reservoir in 1960 the church was abandoned

Jenukal Gudda Hill

Jenukal Gudda is an exciting trekking place near Sakleshpur and boasts the status of being the second-highest peak in Karnataka. The exhilarating trek through the lush green foliage and coffee plantations is also known as Honey Stone Mountain. It offers a clear view of the Arabian Sea on the sunny days and the most unforgettable sunsets that you’ll cherish forever..

Ayappa Swamy Temple

Ayyappa Swami Temple is a prominent temple in Sakleshpur that offers a spiritual retreat and awe-inspiring views of surrounding forests and river valleys. It is situated in Sakleshpur Lake Park where you can take a leisurely walk or enjoy the beautiful sunrise and sunsets. This is one of the refreshing tourist places in Sakleshpur that is suitable for a visit with friends and family.

Shravanabelagola

Shravanbelagola has numerous historical sites, amongst which several Jain temples are present. The town is most famous for the Gomteswara Temple that houses the gigantic Bahubali Statue (58 Feet), supposedly known to be the tallest statue carved out of a single block of granite. The statue was carved between 982 and 983 CE during the reign of King Rajamalla.

Sri Sakleshwar Swamy Temple

One of the most peaceful places to visit in Sakleshpur, Sri Sakleshwar Swamy Temple is a part of the list of oldest temples of Karnataka. Dedicated to the God of destruction – Lord Shiva, Sakleshpur Temple is sitting on the banks of river Hemavathi and gives one a chance to embrace tranquility and peace. One can witness a massive statue of Lord Shiva sitting in the heart of this temple. This statue showcases the Hoysala architecture in the most beautiful manner possible. February is considered as the most vibrant month for temple by virtue of rath yatra that takes place every year from this temple.

Magajahalli Waterfalls

Reeking of vibes of serenity from every corner, the Magajahalli waterfalls are one of the most magical places to visit in Sakleshpur. The waterfalls are some of the most picturesque falls that give one a chance to soak in the beauty of mother nature. Often named as Hanbal and Abbi Gundi Falls, Magajahalli waterfalls appeals to the families and couples alike by virtue of being a popular picnic spot near this town. This is one of those waterfalls near Bangalore that gives travelers an opportunity to witness the breathtakingly beautiful views of the surrounding Pushpagiri Mountain range.
